ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned to build on the fundamentals of Korean from last semester. I also learned to write paragraphs in Korean and speak and read more quickly.
Continuation of basic Korean with more vocabulary and grammar points.
I developed a deeper and more comprehensive understanding of the Korean language in this course. My Korean has improved significantly just from L1 to L2.
Learned how to increase my Korean writing, reading, and listening skills from L1.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This course is well-paced, so you never feel overwhelmed. The content goes exactly with the textbook, and the constant feedback from the professor and  engagement with classmates during group exercises help so much in terms of improving speaking and fluency.
The professor is wonderful! Assignments are all fair and useful to learning Korean. Assessments are straightforward if you study.
There are no weaknesses of this course.

The class is very well organized and I felt that I was constantly learning new materials and improving my Korean. The only weakness is that the textbook is not very useful for independent study or extra practice outside of class. However, Professor Lim provided a lot of support and resources which made up for this.
The course was structured very well. The class was adapted for virtual learning do well that it almost seemed like the class was made for an online format.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I think the breakout rooms during class on Zoom were extremely successful. Professor Lim also gave instant feedback in all classes and tried to encourage everyone to participate when doing reading or speaking exercises. Nothing in particular needed to be improved.
I enjoyed the slides that went through the book material and the frequent use of breakout rooms.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to build on their knowledge from KREN110! I feel like I am much more confident with speaking and reading now.
Yes! Anyone who is interested and/or wants a cool language to fulfill the requirement. The department is so kind!
Yes, I would absolutely recommend this course to another student.
Absolutely! Every class is engaging and Professor Lim is a great professor.
I would recommend this class to any student who tool L1. I would especially recommend Korean to anyone thinking of a language to take, the department here is great!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
